title: Wealdway Walking Route

images.title: Nigel Freeman / Wealdway
images.caption: View of the trail near Uckfield

images.title: Raymond Knapman / Promenade on the Wealdway
images.caption: Promenade on the Wealdway. View towards Eastbourne

images.title: David Anstiss / Kissing Gate on the Wealdway
images.caption: Kissing Gate on the trail. The long distance path heads from the Sussex Border on the River Medway towards Ashurst Road, past Stone Cross House.

images.title: David Anstiss / Peckham Place Farm Oast on Wealdway
images.caption: Peckham Place Farm Oast. This Oast is being used as a barn on this busy polytunnel fields using farm. The long distance path goes through the middle of the farm on an access track.

images.title: Danny Robinson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Farm Track. Just off Camer Road, Sole Street.

images.title: David Anstiss / View from Wealdway
images.caption: Lovely view from path near Trosley Country Park. There's excellent views of the North Downs from the park which also includes a cafe for refreshments. Near here you can also visit the 3000 year old Coldrum Long Barrow.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View NW from the path near Five Hundred Acre Wood.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Autumn in Five Hundred Acre Wood, by the Wealdway

description: Follow the Wealdway from the River Thames at Gravesend to Eastbourne on the Sussex coast. The route crosses the chalk ridges of the North and South Downs and passes through the lovely Weald AONB and the expansive Ashdown Forest . After starting at Gravesend the walk heads through Tonbridge , Royal Tunbridge Wells with its famous Pantiles, Uckfield before finishing at Eastbourne with its splendid views from Beachy Head .
